messageBody:
>So said Alain Ravet on 2003-08-07 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>The most common real-life scenario for me has to do with refactoring
>legacy code. I need tests before I can refactor. If a component is not
>designed to be tested, then I may need to reach into its bowels to write
>the tests I need to start refactoring.
>>
>>I don't have a real-life example at hand, though.
>
>Hard to say without an example, but in such a case, I would simply
>change the visibility of the method from private to package (in java).
>As I put the tests in the same package, but in another source tree, that
>would do the trick.

Now suppose you don't have the source and need to replace the entire legacy component with a new component that has equivalent behavior? (I know it's a different scenario than building a safety net for refactoring.)

Any comments? Thanks.
